### isExecutedInAlignedRegion() {#ab98f3eec1bcf69343c5b4380ad2cd36d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::AAExecutionDomain::isExecutedInAlignedRegion (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I) const</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if the instruction <code>I</code> is executed in an aligned region, that is, the synchronizing effects before and after <code>I</code> are both aligned barriers.

This effectively means all threads execute <code>I</code> together.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l05665">5665</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Helper function to determine if <code>FI</code> is a no-op given the information about its execution from <code>ExecDomainAA</code>.
